TopicSection.Name: BodyText
TopicSection.Content:
Spread.Views supports Excel like number and date formatting.

Excel like formatting is a plugin available that can be used in the grid. In order to use it you need to refer the 'formatter.js' file into the HTML page.

Sample Code

This example shows formatter as a format string:

Javascript JS var columns =[
    {id:'value',name:'Value',field:'value',width:140, formatter:'$#,##0.00'},
];
 
var data =[
  {value : 1200},
  {value : 100},
  {value : 1600},
];
 
SpreadGrid.Grid(container, data, columns);

This example shows formatter as a function:

Javascript JS function format(value, rowItem, colDef){
}

Instead of using the same formatter for an entire column, you can also specify your own formatter to format each value of the column separately. You can do this by defining an object that implements the format function and returns the desired formatted string.
